page.title: 04Tv Reception in FINTRY
page.content:
{Official television reception dates {from 1981,}when a relay station was built at Hill of Balgair to transpose the frequency and re-direct the signal from the Killearn transmitter. The village now enjoys 3 channels on the 625 system. Channel 4 is scheduled for 1987. Potentially 95% of households are able to receive good tv reception. Just two houses are excluded by natural obstacles. Interference from the Burntisland transmitter for some is a problem.
Prior to all this tv viewing was for the lucky few who received pictures bounced off the hills. One enthusiast is still at work. Using a dish aerial he has proved that perfect reception from{satellites}transmitting across the breadth of Russia is available in the village.
